title: Bug 4964 - Automatic Code Assist needs to be smarter
description: When using the automatic code assist feature, I encountered an issue. After typing 'button.', the code assist suggested 'DISPOSED' as the first option, which I accidentally selected. This resulted in incorrect code being inserted - 'button.DISPOSED'. To fix this, I had to manually delete the incorrect code and type it again. It would be helpful if the code assist feature could recognize that I have typed a '(' and suggest 'dispose()' instead of 'DISPOSED', as it is a closer match. Alternatively, the code assist feature could also be case sensitive when automatically inserting suggestions.
OB: The automatic code assist suggests 'DISPOSED' instead of 'dispose()' when typing 'button.'.
EB: The automatic code assist should suggest 'dispose()' instead of 'DISPOSED' when typing 'button.'.
SR:
1. Open the code editor.
2. Type 'button.'.
3. Observe the code assist suggestions.
4. Note the suggested option that is automatically inserted.
5. Compare it with the expected suggestion.
6. Delete the incorrect code and type it again manually.
